newsitem.title: UK: UK's Leicester City FC may reverse into market.
newsitem.headline: UK's Leicester City FC may reverse into market.

text.p: English premier league soccer club Leicester City is likely to join the stock market through a reverse takeover of Soccer Investments Plc, sources close to the deal said on Thursday.
Trading in Soccer Investments shares on AIM was suspended after the company said it was in exclusive discussions which may lead to an offer for Leicester.

Soccer Investments was set up by a group of institutional investors seeking a stake in a British club. It has 10 million stg in cash which would be made available to Leicester to fund stadium expansion and squad strengthening.
"Soccer Investments is a ready-made vehicle for a club seeking a flotation," one of the sources said.
The enlarged company would be relisted as Leicester City Plc and new shares issued to the club's current stockholders if the deal goes ahead.
Leicester, based in the English Midlands, will play in Europe's UEFA Cup next season after winning the English League Cup in the last campaign.
